intro: Cerochlamys trigona, commonly known as the rock fig, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Moraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, three-lobed leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, round, fig-like structure that turns yellow when mature. Cerochlamys trigona is often found growing on rocky outcrops and is adapted to arid environments.
